alert.note: Alert for Bergen (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 29 at 11:49PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Jersey, including the following county, Bergen. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding will continue through much of the overnight for flood-prone areas adjacent to the Hackensack River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1137 PM EDT, river gauges indicated flooding. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. - Any additional rainfall overnight is expected to be light. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... The Rivervale and New Milford gauges are reporting flooding. This will impact locations susceptible to minor flooding along the Hackensack River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
